etymologies: early 20th century (Russian Revolution): from Russian komissar, from French commissaire, from medieval Latin commissarius (see commissary)

definitions: an official of the Communist Party, especially in the former Soviet Union or present-day China, responsible for political education and organization

examples.text: films that are passed by the political commissar

definitions: a head of a government department in the former Soviet Union before 1946.
shortDefinitions: head of government department in former Soviet Union before 1946

definitions: a strict or prescriptive figure of authority
shortDefinitions: strict or prescriptive figure of authority
